Package a12345678.change.to.your.matriculation.number

Interface Trader

All Known Implementing Classes:
Wizard
public interface Trader
Trader objects have an inventory in which they can store magic items. They can trade and use these objects. Additionally they are able to steal and loot objects from other traders.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    addToInventory(Tradeable item)
    If item is null, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; if inventory capacity would be exceeded, return false.
    boolean
    canAfford(int amount)
    If amount is negative, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; returns true if the object has enough money, false otherwise
    default boolean
    canLoot()
    Returns true if the object is capable to loot; default implementation always returns false.
    default boolean
    canSteal()
    Returns true if the object is capable to steal; default implementation always returns false this will be overridden for the class Wizard, so that only living Wizards can steal.
    boolean
    earn(int amount)
    If amount is negative, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; add amount to this object's money and return true.
    boolean
    hasCapacity(int weight)
    If weight is negative, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; returns true if the weight can be added to the object's inventory without exceeding the maximum weight capacity.
    default boolean
    isLootable()
    Returns true if the object can be looted; default implementation always returns false.
    boolean
    loot(Trader looter)
    If looter is null, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; if looter cannot loot (canLoot returns false) no action can be taken and false is returned.
    boolean
    pay(int amount)
    If amount is negative, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; if this owns enough money, deduct amount from money and return true, return false otherwise.
    boolean
    possesses(Tradeable item)
    If item is null an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; returns true if this object possesses the item, false otherwise.
    boolean
    removeFromInventory(Tradeable item)
    If item is null, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; removes item from the inventory and returns true on success, false if removing the item failed.
    boolean
    steal(Trader thief)
    If thief is null, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; if thief cannot steal (canSteal returns false) no action can be taken and false is returned.

  • Method Details

    • possesses

      boolean possesses(Tradeable item)
      If item is null an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; returns true if this object possesses the item, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      item - test if this object possesses this item
      Returns:
      true if the item is in the object's possession, false otherwise

    • canAfford

      boolean canAfford(int amount)
      If amount is negative, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; returns true if the object has enough money, false otherwise
      Parameters:
      amount - amount to be tested for
      Returns:
      true if the object has enough money, false otherwise

    • hasCapacity

      boolean hasCapacity(int weight)
      If weight is negative, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; returns true if the weight can be added to the object's inventory without exceeding the maximum weight capacity.
      Parameters:
      weight - weight to test for
      Returns:
      true, if carrying capacity is sufficient, false otherwise

    • pay

      boolean pay(int amount)
      If amount is negative, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; if this owns enough money, deduct amount from money and return true, return false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      amount - amount to be payed
      Returns:
      true if payment succeeded, false otherwise

    • earn

      boolean earn(int amount)
      If amount is negative, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; add amount to this object's money and return true.
      Parameters:
      amount - amount earned
      Returns:
      true (always)

    • addToInventory

      boolean addToInventory(Tradeable item)
      If item is null, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; if inventory capacity would be exceeded, return false. adds item to the inventory and returns true on success, false if adding the item failed
      Parameters:
      item - item to be stored in inventory
      Returns:
      true if storage was successful, false otherwise

    • removeFromInventory

      boolean removeFromInventory(Tradeable item)
      If item is null, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; removes item from the inventory and returns true on success, false if removing the item failed.
      Parameters:
      item - to remove from inventory
      Returns:
      true, if removal was successful, false otherwise

    • canSteal

      default boolean canSteal()
      Returns true if the object is capable to steal; default implementation always returns false this will be overridden for the class Wizard, so that only living Wizards can steal.
      Returns:
      true, if object is able to steal, false otherwise

    • steal

      boolean steal(Trader thief)
      If thief is null, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; if thief cannot steal (canSteal returns false) no action can be taken and false is returned. returns false if the object's inventory is empty otherwise transfers a random item from the this object's inventory into the thief's inventory; if the thief's inventory has not enough capacity, the object just vanishes and false is returned. returns true if theft was successful
      Parameters:
      thief - the one who steals the object
      Returns:
      true, if theft was successful, false otherwise

    • isLootable

      default boolean isLootable()
      Returns true if the object can be looted; default implementation always returns false. This will be overridden for the class Wizard, so that dead Wizards may be looted
      Returns:
      true if the object can be looted, false otherwise

    • canLoot

      default boolean canLoot()
      Returns true if the object is capable to loot; default implementation always returns false. This will be overridden for the class Wizard, so that only living Wizards can loot
      Returns:
      true if the object can loot another object, false otherwise

    • loot

      boolean loot(Trader looter)
      If looter is null, an IllegalArgumentException must be thrown; if looter cannot loot (canLoot returns false) no action can be taken and false is returned. If the object can be looted (isLootable), transfer all the items in the object's inventory into the looter's inventory; items that don't fit in the looter's inventory because of the weight limitation just vanish returns true if at least one item was successfully transferred, false otherwise}
      Parameters:
      looter - the one who loots the object
      Returns:
      true, if at least one item could be successfully looted, false otherwise
